title: PRESIDENT OF INDIA INAUGURATES FIRST UTTAR PRADESH INTERNATIONAL TRADE SHOW AT GREATER NOIDA
description: The President of India recently spoke at the Uttar Pradesh International Trade Show, emphasizing the importance of increased women’s participation in entrepreneurship and labour force. The Trade Show is displaying products from the 'One District One Product' initiative, and has attracted over 2000 manufacturers and 400 buyers from 66 countries. The President also noted that the Government of Uttar Pradesh has taken several steps to boost economic growth and investment, making it one of the fastest growing state-level economies in India. Uttar Pradesh also ranks first among all the states with more than 96 lakh MSMEs, and exports have increased from Rs. 88,000 crore to Rs. 1,75,000 crore in the last five years.

The President expressed confidence that the Uttar Pradesh International Trade Show will advance G20 goals of local value creation, and connecting MSMEs at the international level. The President also highlighted the importance of the G20 New Delhi Leaders’ Declaration, which included the goal of identifying the challenges faced by MSMEs. She concluded by expressing hope that India will become the third largest economy in the world with Uttar Pradesh’s excellent economic performance.

title: PM thanks all Rajya Sabha MPs who voted for the Nari Shakti Vandan Adhiniyam
description: Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi thanked all the Rajya Sabha MPs for voting in favour of the Nari Shakti Vandan Adhiniyam, a piece of legislation to honour and empower women in India. He congratulated the 140 crore citizens of the country for this defining moment in India's democratic journey.
This is more than just a legislation; it is a tribute to all the women who have made India what it is today, and a commitment to ensure their voices are heard more effectively.
The Prime Minister expressed his gratitude to the MPs and celebrated the strength, courage, and indomitable spirit of all Indian women.

title: PM urges all members, parties and their leaders to support The Constitution (One Hundred and Twenty-Eighth Amendment) Bill, 2023 in the Rajya Sabha
description: The Prime Minister recently concluded the debates on The Constitution (One Hundred and Twenty-Eighth Amendment) Bill, 2023 in the Rajya Sabha. He noted that the debate had been ongoing for two days with 132 Hon’ble Members voicing their opinions. He noted that all members and political parties had played a significant role in the discussion, and the passage of the bill would give a new energy and self-confidence to the people of the country. The Prime Minister also urged the Upper House to pass the bill unanimously.

The Prime Minister further expressed his gratitude for the meaningful discussions, emphasizing that the bill would become a guarantee of India’s bright future and would contribute to nation building. He concluded his address by thanking all members for their support.

title: English rendering of PM’s remarks on Nari Shakti Vandan Adhiniyam in Rajya Sabha
description: Members of the Indian Parliament have held extensive discussions on an important bill for the past two days. Over 132 members from both Houses have come together to engage in meaningful dialogue, expressing their support for the bill. This unified spirit has instilled a sense of confidence among the people of India and all political parties have played a major role in this regard. Women empowerment will be a direct outcome of the passing of this bill, as it will give a new energy to the female population and encourage them to take on leadership roles and contribute to nation-building.

Prime Minister of India thanked the Honorable members for their support and expressed his wish for the Upper House to vote on the bill unanimously, so as to give the country a sense of assurance and confidence. He also expressed his gratitude for the sentiments expressed in the House.

title: PM to interact with Team G20 on 22nd September
description: On 22nd September, Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi will be interacting with Team G20 at Bharat Mandapam. He will be addressing the gathering and will be followed by dinner. Around 3000 people, including functionaries such as cleaners, drivers, waiters and other staff from various Ministries have been invited to the event. The interaction will also be attended by Ministers and officials of various departments.

The 3000 lucky people who have contributed to the success of G20 Summit, will get a once in a lifetime opportunity to interact with Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi and get a chance to dine with him at Bharat Mandapam. They will also get to witness an address by the Prime Minister himself.

title: English rendering of PM’s remarks on Nari Shakti Vandan Adhiniyam in Lok Sabha
description: Yesterday was an important day in India's parliamentary history. Prime Minister of India, in his speech, expressed his gratitude to all the members of Parliament for their unanimous decision and support to the nation's mother power. He stated that this decision will give a great boost to the country and will take it to new heights. The Prime Minister thanked all the members of Parliament, regardless of party, for their contribution and meaningful discussions.
The Prime Minister's speech was translated to English with a disclaimer that the original speech was delivered in Hindi.

title: PM to visit Varanasi on 23rd September
description: Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi will visit Varanasi on 23rd September, 2023 to lay the foundation stone of the International Cricket Stadium in Ganjari, Rajatalab. At the same time, Prime Minister will also dedicate to Nation 16 Atal Awasiya Vidyalaya built across Uttar Pradesh, which are exclusive for children of labourers and construction workers.

The International Cricket Stadium in Varanasi will be developed in more than 30 acre area, at a cost of about Rs 450 crores. The thematic architecture of this stadium draws inspiration from Lord Shiva, with designs developed for crescent shaped roof covers, trident shaped flood-lights, ghat steps based seating, Bilvipatra shaped metallic sheets on the facade. This stadium will have a capacity of 30,000 spectators.

Sixteen Atal Awasiya Vidyalaya across Uttar Pradesh, built at a cost of about Rs 1115 crores, have been started with an aim to provide quality education and help in holistic development of Children. Each school is constructed in an area of 10-15 acres with classrooms, sports ground, recreational areas, a mini auditorium, hostel complex, mess and residential flats for staff.

title: PM Narendra Modi interacts with ground level functionaries of G20 Summit at Bharat Mandapam
description: The Prime Minister recently spoke at a function organized to celebrate the success of the G20 summit. He highlighted the role of the ground level functionaries in the successful organization of the summit and asked them to document their experiences and learning for future reference. He also discussed the importance of collective efforts and coming out of hierarchies in offices and for making an effort to know the strengths of colleagues. The Prime Minister also credited the ground level functionaries for the success of the summit and highlighted the importance of global exposure to further progress. He also spoke about the international relief work done by India and the impact of the summit on the public. Approximately 3000 people attended the function and interacted with the Prime Minister.

The Prime Minister asked the attendees to take collective efforts to ensure success of projects and make them a festival instead of a chore. He also discussed the need to understand the capabilities of colleagues and the power of collective spirit in achieving success. He gave an example of the Commonwealth Games and how it had defamed the country and people involved. On the other hand, the G20 Summit was a success and showcased the strength of the country to the world. Finally, the Prime Minister asked the attendees to use the summit as an opportunity to promote tourism in India.

title: PM pays tributes to Rajmata Vijaya Raje Scindia Ji on her Jayanti
description: Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi paid tribute to the late Rajmata Vijaya Raje Scindia on her Jayanti. He praised her dedication to public welfare and national service, and highlighted her efforts in uplifting the poor and underprivileged as inspiration to build a strong India.
Shri Modi shared his tribute to Rajmata Vijaya Raje Scindia on X, expressing admiration for her lifelong commitment to the welfare of her nation and its citizens.

title: PRESIDENT OF INDIA ATTENDS CIVIC RECEPTION AT RAJ BHAVAN SRINAGAR
description: President of India, Smt Droupadi Murmu, was welcomed with a civic reception at Raj Bhavan, Srinagar on October 11, 2023. She expressed her gratitude for the warm welcome and noted the presence of eminent personalities from the region.

The President highlighted the importance of Kashmir as a major centre of art, culture and education since ancient times, with the 4th Buddhist Council being held in the region 2000 years ago. She also mentioned the works of Abhinavagupta and Sheikh Nooruddin and the contributions of rulers like Zain-ul-Abidin.

The President expressed her hopes for the new era of progress, peace and prosperity that has begun in the region. She also mentioned the record number of 1.7 crore tourists that have visited Jammu and Kashmir until September 2023.

The President concluded her speech by emphasizing the need to strengthen the legacy of peace and tranquility in Jammu and Kashmir, and expressed her confidence in the people's enthusiasm towards making India a developed nation by 2047.

title: PRESIDENT OF INDIA GRACES THE 20TH CONVOCATION OF UNIVERSITY OF KASHMIR
description: President Droupadi Murmu addressed the 20th convocation of the University of Kashmir in Srinagar today. She praised the youth of Kashmir for their commitment to social service and urged them to strive for progress and prosperity. She also encouraged the 55% female students to take on a leadership role in the country. She highlighted the importance of sustainable development and preserving the Himalayan ecosystem. Lastly, she spoke about the National Education Policy, emphasizing the importance of Indian Knowledge Systems.

The President's speech is a reminder of the necessity to use organically grown knowledge systems in today's circumstances and to prioritize the growth of the Indian youth. She cited the example of Suyya and his 1200 year old work of saving the city of Srinagar from the flood of Jhelum. Her words signify the need to move from darkness to light and to preserve the paradise on earth.

title: PM congratulates Indian Cricket Team for winning first two matches of ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023
description: Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has congratulated the Indian Cricket Team for winning the first two matches of ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023 against Australia and Afghanistan. The Prime Minister expressed his joy on social media by saying that the team's impressive victory against Australia was followed by an equally impressive win against Afghanistan.
The Prime Minister's post depicted his contentment and appreciation for the team's hard work and dedication, and wished them the best of luck for their future matches.

title: Women MPs are making our democracy more vibrant by focusing on vital sectors: PM
description: Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has acknowledged the contribution of women Members of Parliament in enriching Indian democracy and hopes that the Nari Shakti Vandan Adhiniyam will further bolster the people's voice.

The Prime Minister recently shared an article on X written by Shamika Ravi that highlights the various ways in which female MPs are making the Indian democracy stronger. These include focusing on important sectors such as healthcare, education, infrastructure, and more.
The Prime Minister has expressed his faith in the Nari Shakti Vandan Adhiniyam to further amplify the people's voice, empowering them to make a real difference in the country.

title: PM pays tributes to Bharat Ratna Nanaji Deshmukh on his Jayanti
description: The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, paid tribute to Bharat Ratna Nanaji Deshmukh on his Jayanti. Shri Modi said that Nanaji Deshmukh devoted his life to the development of villages and tribal areas of the country. He praised Nanaji's spirit of sacrifice and service, which will serve as an inspiration for every generation.

In a post, the Prime Minister said; “I offer my respectful tributes to Bharat Ratna Nanaji Deshmukh on his birth anniversary. He dedicated his life to the development of villages and tribal areas of the country. His spirit of sacrifice and service will remain a source of inspiration for every generation.”

title: India is a global bright spot, a powerhouse of growth and innovation: Prime Minister
description: The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, commented on the growth forecast of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), stating that India is a global bright spot, a powerhouse of growth and innovation, due to the strength and skills of its people. He reiterated his commitment to further boost the reforms trajectory with the goal of creating a prosperous India.

Responding to the IMF’s threads, Shri Narendra Modi declared that India is a global bright spot, driven by the strength and skills of its citizens, and that the Government will continue to strengthen the path towards a prosperous India by boosting reforms.

title: Cabinet approves royalty rates for mining of three critical and strategic minerals- Lithium, Niobium and Rare Earth Elements (REEs)
description: The Union Cabinet recently approved an amendment to the Second Schedule of the Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act, 1957 for specifying the rate of royalty in respect of 3 critical and strategic minerals, namely, Lithium, Niobium and Rare Earth Elements (REEs). This amendment was passed by the Parliament and came into effect from 17th August, 2023. It delisted Lithium and Niobium from the list of atomic minerals, thereby allowing private sector concessions for these minerals through auction. It also provided that mining lease and composite license of 24 critical and strategic minerals, including Lithium, Niobium and REEs, shall be auctioned by the Central Government.

Today's approval of the Union Cabinet of specification of royalty rate will enable the Central Government to auction blocks for Lithium, Niobium and REEs for the first time in India. The Second Schedule of the MMDR Act provides a default royalty rate of 12% of the Average Sale Price (ASP) for minerals whose royalty rate is not specified. This rate, however, is not comparable with other mineral producing countries. The Union Cabinet has thus specified a reasonable royalty rate of 3% of London Metal Exchange price for Lithium, 3% of Average Sale Price for Niobium and 1% of Average Sale Price of Rare Earth Oxide for REEs.

Critical minerals such as Lithium and REEs have become essential for economic development and national security in the country. India is committed towards energy transition and achieving net-zero emission by 2070. Geological Survey of India (GSI) has handed over exploration reports of REE and Lithium blocks and is conducting exploration for other critical and strategic minerals. The Central Government is planning to launch the first tranche of the auction of critical and strategic minerals such as Lithium, REE, Nickel, Platinum Group of Elements, Potash, Glauconite, Phosphorite, Graphite, Molybdenum, etc. shortly.
keyWords: Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act

title: Cabinet approves Memorandum of Understanding between India and Papua New Guinea on cooperation in the field of sharing successful Digital Solutions implemented at Population Scale for Digital Transformation
description: The Union Cabinet, chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has approved a Memorandum of Understanding between India's Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology and the Ministry of Information and Communications Technology of Papua New Guinea. The MoU aims to promote cooperation and exchange of digital solutions, such as India Stack, to help with digital transformation initiatives in both countries.

The MoU will be in effect for three years and will enhance both Government-to-Government (G2G) and Business-to-Business (B2B) bilateral cooperation in the field of Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI). It also envisages improved collaboration leading to employment opportunities in the field of IT.

India has been collaborating with other countries and multilateral agencies to foster bilateral and multilateral cooperation in the ICT domain. These efforts are in line with India's Digital India, Atmanirbhar Bharat, Make in India initiatives, with the goal of transforming the country into a digitally empowered society and knowledge economy.

India has implemented Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI) solutions at a population scale, providing access and delivery of public services, and has been successful in doing so even during the COVID pandemic. This has garnered interest from other countries to learn from India's experiences and enter into agreements with India.

title: Cabinet approves Memorandum of Understanding between India and  France on cooperation in the field of Digital Technologies
description: The Union Cabinet, chaired by Prime Minister Sheri Narendra Modi, has approved the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between India and France in the field of Digital Technologies. The MoU intends to promote closer cooperation and exchange of information in the digital sector, leading to increased employment opportunities and investment in the field. It will provide opportunities for both government-to-government and business-to-business collaboration, as India and France pursue an ambitious bilateral cooperation on advanced digital technologies. The cooperation under this MoU will last five years.

MeitY, the Indian Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, has been mandated to promote international cooperation in the emerging and frontier areas of information Technology. India and France have a long-standing strategic partnership in the Indo-European region and are committed to nurturing a thriving digital ecosystem. The Indian-French Roadmap on Cyber Security and Digital Technology, announced in 2019, provides the framework for cooperation in the fields of supercomputing, cloud computing, Artificial Intelligence and quantum technologies.

title: Cabinet approves Memorandum of Understanding between India and Trinidad and Tobago on cooperation in the field of sharing successful Digital Solutions implemented at Population Scale for Digital Transformation
description: Today, the Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi approved a Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology of India and the Ministry of Digital Transformation Technology of Trinidad and Tobago to promote cooperation in the field of digital public infrastructure (DPI). The MoU aims to share successful digital solutions implemented at a population scale for digital transformation.

The MoU will facilitate both government-to-government and business-to-business bilateral cooperation in the field of DPI. It is also expected to create new job opportunities in the Information Technology sector.

India has been collaborating with various countries and multilateral agencies to foster bilateral and multilateral cooperation in the ICT domain. The MoU is in line with the Digital India, Atmanirbhar Bharat, Make in India initiatives of the Indian government to transform India into a digitally empowered society and knowledge economy.

India has developed and implemented unique digital public infrastructure solutions (Indis Stack Solutions) at a population scale to provide access and delivery of public services. The MoU will offer a platform to share best practices and attract investments in the digital sector to enhance mutual cooperation.
keyWords: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology

title: Cabinet approves establishment of an autonomous body Mera Yuva Bharat
description: The Union Cabinet, chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has approved the establishment of an autonomous body, Mera Yuva Bharat (MY Bharat), to enable youth development and youth-led development. MY Bharat aims to provide equitable access to young people to realize their aspirations and build a better India across the Government spectrum.

The primary objective of Mera Yuva Bharat (MY Bharat) is to create a whole of Government platform for youth development. Under the new arrangement, young people will be provided with access to resources and opportunities, allowing them to act as a bridge between the Government and citizens and harness their energy for nation-building.

Mera Yuva Bharat (MY Bharat) will benefit the youth aged between 15-29 years, in line with the definition of ‘Youth’ in the National Youth Policy. For programme components focused on adolescents, the beneficiaries will fall within the age group of 10-19 years.

title: Women and youth agri-preneurs need support to foster just and resilient agri-food systems
description: The International Gender Conference at the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR-NASC Pusa) commenced with President of India Smt Droupadi Murmu inaugurating the four-day event. The conference, which focuses on just and resilient agri-food systems, brings together business leaders, model farmers, and scientists to address challenges faced by women and youth agri-preneurs, such as lack of access to finance, limited land ownership, informal and unpaid work, and few opportunities to voice their needs.

The second day saw a total of 18 parallel sessions, with presentations of more than 80 scientific posters on topics such as remedies for reducing the drudgeries of women farmers in post-harvest processing of millets, gender gaps among women street vendors and hawkers, and gendered drivers of seed choice among farmers in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana.

Dr Nicoline de Haan, Director of the CGIAR GENDER Impact Platform, highlighted the significance of the conference, noting that women are often less food secure than men, and are hit harder by external shocks, such as floods and droughts. She expressed the need to guide policy-makers and investors towards best-bet solutions that can help to achieve Global Goals on gender equality and women’s empowerment.

The panel discussion on the second day of the conference featured Smt. Anusha Jookuri, Founder and Director of Bee Fresh Products; Shri Dhruv Tomar, Founder and Managing Director of M Lense Research Private Limited; Shri Jyotsna Kaur Habibullah, CEO of Lucknow Farmers Market; and Dr. Akriti Sharma, CEO of Pusa Krishi and Senior Scale Scientist at ICAR. The panelists discussed the lack of access to finance for women agri-preneurs as well as the invisibility of women's unpaid work.

Dr Soma K Parthasarathy delivered a keynote presentation, proposing that a move towards circular economies could be achieved by granting women access to spaces in which they can make their voices heard, by making women count in data, and through exchanges of seeds. She also suggested that women’s roles and voices in climate discourse and in the formulation of policies on land and forest conservation should be enhanced.

Shri Eleanor Dean, General Manager of Outreach & Capacity Building, at the Australian Centre for International Agricultural Research (ACIAR), closed the session by noting that poverty and inequality are underpinned by unequal power relations that are not exclusive to gender, and that ACIAR has expanded its work to encompass gender equality and social inclusion.

title: Changes notified in Production Linked Incentive Scheme for White Goods (ACs and LED Lights)
description: The Indian government has recently implemented a Production Linked Incentive Scheme (PLI) for White Goods which includes Air Conditioners (ACs) and LED Lights. This scheme has an outlay of 6,238 crore rupees and is designed to create a complete component ecosystem for the Air Conditioner and LED Lights industry in India. The goal of the scheme is to increase domestic value addition from 15-20% to 75-80%.

Various changes have been made to the Scheme Guidelines with a view to simplify the operation of the Scheme as well as to improve the ease of doing business. These changes include adoption of the Cost-Plus method, investments in Tool rooms for manufacturing, allowing one extra year for informing the establishment of an additional manufacturing facility, revision of the last date of submission of filing claims, refund of excess incentive, site visit by the Administrative Ministry and rolling over of Bank Guarantee.

Out of the 64 selected beneficiaries, 15 beneficiaries have already started commercial production while the rest are at different stages of implementation. This PLI Scheme for White Goods is in line with the Prime Minister’s call for “Atmanirbhar Bharat” and is expected to create more jobs and drive India’s growth.

title: Extension of further time for receiving comments on “Consultation Paper on ‘Review of Quality-of-Service Standards for Access Services (Wireless and Wireline) and Broadband (Wireless and Wireline) Services’
description: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) has issued a Consultation Paper on ‘Review of Quality-of-Service Standards for Access Services (Wireless and Wireline) and Broadband (Wireless and Wireline) Services’ on 18th August 2023. The paper is very comprehensive and detailed from all aspects of business.

Stakeholders had requested for an extension of time for submission of comments on the paper. TRAI has decided to extend the last date for submission of written comments from the stakeholders to 22nd November 2023 and counter comments by 6th December 2023.

Written comments on the Consultation paper may be sent to the email address adv-qos1@trai.gov.in and all comments will be posted on the TRAI’s website. For any clarification/information, Shri Tejpal Singh, Advisor (QoS-I) TRAI may be contacted at Tel. No. +91-11-23236516.

title: TRAI extended time to submit comments/counter comments on the consultation paper “Digital Inclusion in the Era of Emerging Technologies”
description: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) recently released a Consultation Paper (CP) titled “Digital Inclusion in the Era of Emerging Technologies” on the 14th of September 2023.

The stakeholders were initially given a deadline of 16th October 2023 to submit their comments, and 31st October 2023 for counter comments. However, on request from the stakeholders, the last date for submission of comments has been extended to 16th November 2023 and counter comments upto 1st December 2023.
In case of any clarifications, Shri Anand Kumar Singh, Advisor (CA&IT) at TRAI may be contacted via telephone at 011-23210990 or email at advisorit@trai.gov.in.

title: Extension of last date to receive comments on TRAI Pre-Consultation Paper on Inputs for Formulation of “National Broadcasting Policy”
description: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) has released a pre-consultation paper on Inputs for Formulation of “National Broadcasting Policy” on 21st September 2023.
The deadline to submit comments from stakeholders had been set as 10th October 2023. However, due to requests from stakeholders for an extension, the deadline has been extended to 31st October 2023.

Comments can be sent, preferably in electronic form, to the email IDs advbcs-2@trai.gov.in and jtadvbcs-1@trai.gov.in. For further information or clarifications, Shri Anil Kumar Bhardwaj, Advisor (B&CS) can be contacted at Tel. No. +91-11-23237922.

title: Raksha Mantri Shri Rajnath Singh meets CEOs of top French defence companies in Paris
description: On October 11, 2023, Raksha Mantri Shri Rajnath Singh visited the Safran Engine Division's R&D Centre at Gennevilliers near Paris, France. He was received with a warm welcome by Global CEO Olivier Andries, who provided a detailed briefing on the Centre's latest developments of aero-engine technology. During his visit, Shri Rajnath Singh highlighted the advantages of co-development and co-production in India, including possibilities of exports to third countries. Later in the day, he also held the 5th Annual Defence Dialogue with the French Minister of Armed Forces, Mr Sebastien Lecornu. On the same day, Shri Rajnath Singh interacted with the Indian community at the India House and spoke about the recent achievements of India in the defence sector.

Earlier on October 10, Shri Rajnath Singh had embarked on a two-nation tour to France. His visit was highly appreciated by the French defence companies and their CEOs, including Mr Eric Trappier, CEO Dassault; Mr Pierre Eric Pommellet, CEO Naval Group; Mr Guillaume Faury, CEO Airbus; and Mr Olivier Andries, CEO Safran Group. These companies expressed their interest in being a part of India's growth story by working together on mutually agreed joint projects.

title: ADMIRAL R HARI KUMAR, CHIEF OF THE NAVAL STAFF ADDRESSES THE STATION COMMANDERS’ WORKSHOP AT VISAKHAPATNAM
description: Admiral R Hari Kumar, Chief of the Naval Staff and Mrs. Kala Hari Kumar, President of Naval Welfare and Wellness Association, arrived in Visakhapatnam on a two-day visit to the Eastern Naval Command on 10 October 2023. Vice Adm Rajesh Pendharkar, Commander-in-Chief of ENC, welcomed them and briefed them on the progress of the ongoing major operational issues and projects in the Command.

The 2nd edition of the Station Commanders’ Workshop (SCW 23/2) was held at Eastern Naval Command, Visakhapatnam from 09 - 11 October 2023. The workshop was attended by more than 100 delegates, including commanding officers of naval hospitals, officers from Naval Armament Inspection Units, Naval Liaison Cells and Material Organisations. The CNS addressed the Station Commanders Workshop and also participated in various other engagements.

Mrs. Kala Hari Kumar, President of NWWA, conducted an information session on NWWA which was attended by the Station Commanders, Unit heads of MOs, NLCs, NAIs and NWWA members. She familiarised them with recent initiatives undertaken by NWWA, for the benefit of the naval community, and emphasised the role of leadership in ensuring community welfare. She also talked about the upcoming G20ThINQ event in November at Mumbai and Delhi.

Admiral R Hari Kumar also participated in 25th anniversary celebrations of INS Kora and interacted with the ships’ company of Eastern Fleet ships and attended the traditional Barakhana. This event was of particular significance as both the CNS and the C-in-C are the former Commanding Officers of INS Kora.

On the occasion of Mental Health Day on 10th October, the CNS addressed the Naval community and Defence Civilians, emphasizing the importance and benefits of maintaining sound mental health. The address was relayed online across all naval stations.

The CNS inaugurated a state-of-the-art Emergency Diesel Generator Facility at Naval Dockyard Visakhapatnam, capable of providing 7.5 MW of emergency power backup. He interacted with the Defence Civilian workforce at Naval Dockyard. He also inaugurated a Defence Civilian Accommodation block and an Officers' Transit Accommodation block with state-of-the-art facilities.

title: MeitY takes part in Special Campaign 3.0 with great zeal and enthusiasm to Institutionalise Swachhata
description: The Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY) organized a Special Campaign (Swachhata Hi Seva) on 2nd October 2023 at the Electronics Niketan Building in Delhi and the National Capital Region. More than 400 officers and officials of MeitY and its associated offices such as the CCA, ICERT, STQC, NIC, UIDAI, NIELIT, STPI, ERNET India, NIXI, NICSI, C-DAC, My-Gov, NeGD, DIC, CSC and CISF gathered at 7.30 a.m. to participate in the event.

The event included various activities such as general cleaning in and around the building, repair and maintenance work, weeding out of old and unused files and registers and removal of old and unusable furniture and other items, cutting of grass and trimming and removal of waste materials and a special drive for cleaning the offices and buildings of MeitY and its Organisations. Photographs and videos of the event were also taken and uploaded on the SHS Portal.

Moreover, MeitY and its organisations also undertook special activities such as general cleaning at their respective offices, special cleaning of the Delhi Kali Mandir by UIDAI, beach cleaning by C-DAC Mumbai, river cleaning by C-DAC Pune and garden cleaning by C-MET Thrissur.

title: Cabinet approves Memorandum of Understanding between India and France on cooperation in the field of Digital Technologies
description: The Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Sheri Narendra Modi has approved the signing of the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology of the Republic of India and the Ministry of Economy, Finance and Industrial and Digital Sovereignty of the French Republic on cooperation in the field of Digital Technologies.

The MoU intends to promote closer cooperation and exchange of information related to digital technologies and support the goal of both countries to increase access to digital technology. This agreement is expected to create business opportunities and attract investment in the digital sector.

India and France are committed to nurturing a thriving digital ecosystem and building collaborations that empower their citizens and ensure their full participation in the digital century. Based on the Indo-French Road Map on Cyber Security and Digital Technology announced in 2019, India and France are pursuing an ambitious bilateral cooperation on advanced digital technologies.

title: Cabinet approves Memorandum of Understanding between India and Papua New Guinea on cooperation in the field of sharing successful Digital Solutions implemented at Population Scale for Digital Transformation
description: The Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, recently approved a Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology of India and the Ministry of Information and Communications Technology of Papua New Guinea. The MoU is aimed at promoting collaboration in the field of Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI) and sharing successful digital solutions implemented at population scale for digital transformation.

The MoU will enhance Government-to-Government and Business-to-Business bilateral cooperation, and will provide employment opportunities in the field of Information Technology. India has taken a number of initiatives such as Digital India, Atmanirbhar Bharat and Make in India to transform the country into a digitally empowered society and knowledge economy. India Stack Solutions are DPIs developed and implemented at population scale to provide access and delivery of public services.

The MoU shall come into effect from the date of signature of the Parties and shall remain in force for a period of 3 years. It is in consonance with the various initiatives taken by Government of India to foster bilateral and multilateral cooperation in the ICT domain.

title: Cabinet approves Memorandum of Understanding between India and Trinidad and Tobago on cooperation in the field of sharing successful Digital Solutions implemented at Population Scale for Digital Transformation
description: The Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi has given its approval to a Memorandum of Understanding between India and Trinidad and Tobago for cooperation in the field of Digital Transformation. The MoU intends to foster closer cooperation and sharing of successful digital solutions implemented at population scale. The agreement will come into effect from the date of signature and will remain in force for 3 years.

The MoU will lead to improved Government-to-Government and Business-to-Business bilateral cooperation in the field of Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI). The agreement also envisages enhanced collaboration resulting in new employment opportunities in the field of Information Technology. The Indian Government has taken initiatives such as Digital India, Atmanirbhar Bharat, Make in India to transform India into a digitally empowered society and knowledge economy.

As part of the agreement, India will share its digital public infrastructure solutions such as INDIS STACK which are built on open technologies, are interoperable and are designed to harness industry and community participation. Such solutions have helped India during the Covid-19 pandemic, leading to increased interest from other countries in India's digital model.

title: Dr. Vivek Joshi, Secretary, Department of Finance Services (DFS) chairs stakeholders meeting on Rural Infrastructure Development Fund (RIDF) in New Delhi
description: Dr. Vivek Joshi, Secretary of the Department of Financial Services of India's Ministry of Finance, chaired a Stakeholders meeting on the Rural Infrastructure Development Fund (RIDF) today. The meeting was attended by Dr. M.P. Tangirala, Addl. Secretary of the DFS and Chairman of NABARD; the Managing Director of the National Housing Board (NHB); Finance Secretaries; and other senior officers from the State and UT Governments.

Dr. Joshi highlighted the role of the RIDF in transforming rural economies and emphasized the need to expedite completion of projects that are older than 3 years for all State Governments. Dr. Tangirala presented a detailed overview of RIDF achievements and plans moving forward. State and UT Governments then discussed topics related to the RIDF in smaller breakout sessions.

Dr. Joshi applauded the constructive observations and suggestions that came out of the deliberations and asked NABARD to review its guidelines and procedures related to the RIDF in order to speed up project implementations. Shri Kartikeya Misra, Director of the DFS, summarized the main outcomes of the meeting and thanked all the participants.

title: DFS and its organizations actively undertake Special Campaign 3.0 to dispose off pendency & improve cleanliness
description: The Union Minister of State for Finance, Dr. Bhagwat Kishanrao Karad, visited the Department of Financial Services (DFS) on 5th October 2023 to review the progress of multiple initiatives being undertaken as part of Special Campaign 3.0. This campaign was launched on 2nd October 2023 with the aim to reduce the pendency of cases and promote cleanliness. As part of the campaign, more than 10,000 public grievances and appeals will be addressed and 25,000 locations across the country will be cleaned.

The Minister also visited the record room of the DFS and instructed the officials to use the campaign period to manage records as per the existing procedures of record management. Various banners have been displayed to inform the public about the types of activities that will be undertaken during the campaign period, which will end on 31st October 2023.
The organizations of DFS are actively promoting the campaign on social media platforms.

title: Union Home Minister and Minister of Cooperation Shri Amit Shah participated as the chief guest in the consecration program of the statue of Brahmaleen Mahant Shri Chandnath Yogi jiand Deshmelain Rohtak, Haryana today
description: Union Home Minister and Minister of Cooperation Shri Amit Shah attended the unveiling ceremony of the statue of BrahmaleenMahantShri Chandnath Yogi ji and Deshmela in Rohtak, Haryana as chief guest. Union Minister Shri Bhupendra Yadav and many other dignitaries were present on this occasion.

Shri Amit Shah said that the Nath sect has a unique position among Hindu sects and it is said to have been started by Lord Shiva himself. He added that many saints from Baba Mastnath to Baba Balaknathji have worked to create many dimensions of social service and their tradition of service has been going on since the 8th century.

Shri Amit Shah praised Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi's initiatives for the development of sports in India, such as searching for talents from village to national level, arranging for their training, worrying about their finances and physical nutrition, and selection of players in a transparent manner. He also mentioned the Delhi Declaration passed by the G20 conference and the work done by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi to restore many cultural heritages of the country.

Shri Amit Shah said that Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has taken forward the Indian heritage of Yoga and Ayurveda by popularizing them in front of the whole world. He also said that Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has connected South and North through Kashi Tamil Sangamam, Kashi Telugu Sangamam and Kashi Saurashtra Sangamam.

title: PM reviews progress on schemes based on the announcements in his Independence Day speech
description: Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi recently chaired a high level review meeting to assess the progress of the schemes discussed in his Independence Day speech. He discussed the plans to make 2 crore Lakhpati didis, i.e. empowering 2 crore women engaged in SHGs or Anganwadis. He also reviewed the plans to equip 15,000 women Self Help Groups with drones for agricultural and related purposes as well as taking the number of Jan Aushadhi Stores in India to 25,000 from 10,000 currently to increase access to affordable medicines.

The Prime Minister’s vision is to empower women by providing them with better livelihood opportunities, as well as access to modern technology and affordable medicine, to ensure a better future for all.

title: Prime Minister condoles the demise of Padma Shri awardee, Dahyabhai Shastri, an Indian scholar of Sanskrit and the founder of Brahmarshi Sanskrit Mahavidyalaya, Nadiad
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has expressed deep grief over the demise of Padma Shri awardee, Dahyabhai Shastri, an Indian scholar of Sanskrit and the founder of Brahmarshi Sanskrit Mahavidyalaya, Nadiad. Shastriji's contribution towards the promotion of Sanskrit language and education will always be remembered. May the Almighty grant peace to his soul and provide solace to his family and followers.
In a post, the Prime Minister said, 'Ishwar grant Shastriji's soul peace and provide solace to his family and followers.'

title: People of India stand firmly with Israel in this difficult hour: PM
description: Indian Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi expressed his gratitude to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for informing him of the current situation in Israel. He denounced terrorism in all its forms, voicing his country's support for Israel during this difficult time. Modi also posted on X, condemning terrorism and expressing India's unwavering solidarity with Israel.
The Prime Minister's post on X was an affirmation of India's firm stance against terrorism in all its forms and his unwavering support for Israel in its time of need.

title: The science of Ayurveda benefits Animal, Plant as well as Human life imbibing environment: Sarbananda Sonowal
description: Union Minister of Ayush and Ports, Shipping and Waterways Shri Sarbananda Sonowal unveiled a month-long celebration drive for the 8th National Ayurveda Day at a press conference held at the media center today. This day is celebrated across India in honour of Lord Dhanvantari, God of Ayurveda, and coincides with Dhanteras, seeking divine blessings for good health.

In his address to the press, Shri Sarbananda Sonowal spoke about the importance of 'Jan Sandesh, Jan Bhagidhari and Jan Andolan for Jan Arogya' with respect to Ayurveda, and how the Ministry of Ayush is looking to explore the science's potential in promoting holistic wellbeing. The theme chosen for this year is 'Ayurveda for One Health', in line with the G20 Presidency's 'Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam' and the focal theme for the 2023 Ayurveda Day being 'Ayurveda for everyone on every day'.

The Union Minister also discussed the whole government approach being taken to the month-long celebrations and spoke about how India, under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, is looking to bring about a revolution in healthcare by utilizing the potential of Ayurveda. Various programs are being conducted throughout the country to sensitize students, farmers and the public on the science. This year's Ayurveda Day falls on 10th November, 2023.

Secretary of the Ministry of Ayush, Vaidya Rajesh Kotecha, informed the press that 12,500 Ayush Health and Wellness Centers have been approved under the National Ayurveda Mission, of which 8095 are already operational. The month-long Ayurveda campaign will include exhibitions, medical camps, public awareness lectures, competitions and more.

Shri Sarbananda Sonowal reiterated that the theme has been selected with a focus on promoting Agro-Ayurveda and encouraging people to participate in their own health and wellbeing. Central Council for Research in Ayurvedic Science (CCRAS) will be the coordinating agency for the Ayurveda Day programs in 2023 along with its 30 units spread across the country.
keyWords: Har din har kisi ke liye Ayurveda

title: "Gaganyaan" Test Vehicle Space flight, that is, "Gaganyaan" Test Vehicle Development flight (TV-D1) scheduled on 21st October, says Union Minister Dr Jitendra Singh
description: The Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) Science & Technology; MoS PMO, Personnel, Public Grievances, Pensions, Atomic Energy and Space, Dr Jitendra Singh, recently announced the launch of India's first human spaceflight mission, 'Gaganyaan', to be conducted on the 21st of this month. The mission, developed by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), will test the Crew Escape System as well as the Crew Module which will carry the astronauts to outer space.

The test involves launching the Crew Module to outer space and bringing it back to Earth, where it will be recovered by the Indian Navy. The success of this test will set the stage for the first unmanned mission and ultimately a manned mission to outer space in low Earth orbit. This is planned for 2024, and will be preceded by a test flight next year, which will carry the female robot astronaut, 'Vyommitra'.

The Gaganyaan project envisages the demonstration of human spaceflight capabilities by launching a crew to an orbit of 400 km and bringing them back safely to earth. This requires the development of critical technologies such as a human-rated launch vehicle, Life Support System, and crew emergency escape provisions. The mission also requires the management of crew training, recovery and rehabilitation.

India is one of the top five countries in the field of space exploration, having recently created history by becoming the first country to land on the virgin south polar region of the lunar surface. The launch of Aditya-1, the first space-based Indian mission to study the Sun, has further cemented India's standing in the field of space science and technology.

Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has enabled India's space scientists to fulfill the dream of their founding father Vikram Sarabhai by 'unlocking' India's space sector and providing a suitable environment for the country's potential and talent to be showcased to the world. This has resulted in an exponential increase in the number of Space Startups, from 4 to 150 since the sector was opened up in June 2020.

India's space missions are designed to be cost-effective and the applications of space technology have improved the ease of living for the common man, with its use in sectors such as Railways, Highways, Agriculture, Water Mapping, Smart Cities, Telemedicine and Robotic Surgery. Additionally, India's disaster capabilities have become world-class during Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi's tenure of nine years.

ISRO is the epitome of India's Naarishakti, with women scientists participating and leading the various activities in space research programmes. To recognize the achievements of ISRO scientists associated with the Chandrayaan mission, the Union Minister recently felicitated them.

title: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Small Farmers Agri-Business Association and CSC jointly organized FPO Mela in Delhi Haat to showcase FPO products and promote farmer empowerment
description: The Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Small Farmers Agri-Business Association (SFAC), and Common Service Centers (CSC) recently organized a Farmer Producer Organization (FPO) Mela at INA Market, Delhi Haat. Major FPOs from all over the country exhibited their products from over 20 FPOs, allowing visitors to experience the natural produce.

FPOs are groups of farmers that manage commercial farming activities in their local area. They provide farmers with discounted prices on agricultural inputs such as manure, seeds, fertilizers and equipment, and help them sell their finished crops and produce.

The government has either formed or is in the process of forming an FPO in every block in the country, with more than 2,165 FPOs of 8 lakh farmers currently doing business through the online platform ONDC. CSCs are providing rural citizens with access to a variety of government services at their doorstep, such as caste, income, domicile, character certificates, and employment registration.

CSCs have played an important role in the e-governance sector, with more than 5.5 lakh CSCs located in rural areas of the country. Similarly, FPOs are a crucial part of the agricultural sector, with an estimated 12 crore small and marginal farmers in India with an average land holding size of less than 1.1 hectares.

The FPO Mela was a successful event that showcased the products and services offered by FPOs, as well as providing a platform for farmers to learn about the benefits and how to access FPO services. The government's focus on promoting FPOs is a welcome step that will help to empower farmers and boost the rural economy.

title: Union Minister Parshottam Rupala calls for innovations to foster sustainable agri-food systems
description: Union Minister of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying Parshottam Rupala recently highlighted the need for transforming agri-food systems into sustainable enterprises through scientific innovations while inaugurating the 16th Agricultural Science Congress in Kochi. He stated that agricultural scientists should strive to infuse greater mechanisation in the agriculture production process and develop and popularise specialised farm implements for women in agriculture.

Rupala also shared his observation during the Sagar Parkirama drive that marine and inland water pollution has seriously affected aquatic life and coastal ecology. He urged scientists to find lasting and sustainable solutions to address this perilous threat. He suggested that traditional farm products such as pokkali rice needs to be promoted and measures taken to ensure profitability for the pokkali farmers.

The Union Minister further added that the future of India’s agriculture depends a lot on how the accumulated scientific knowledge can be translated to commercial success. He also inaugurated the Agri Expo which showcases innovative agricultural technologies of public and private sector research institutes, universities, agro-industries, extension agencies and NGOs.

Kerala Agriculture Minister P Prasad spoke on ensuring food and nutritional security for all citizens of the country, while maintaining the health of the ecosystem and environment intact. He highlighted the need for carbon neutral development pathways and focus on newer technologies to augment production, while addressing post-harvest sector concerns.

The event was attended by several dignitaries including Hibi Eden MP, Dr J K Jena, Deputy Director General of ICAR, Dr Himanshu Pathak, Secretary to the Department of Agricultural Research and Education (DARE) and Director General of the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR).

title: PM to inaugurate 141st International Olympic Committee (IOC) Session in Mumbai
description: On 14th October 2023, Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi will inaugurate the 141st International Olympic Committee (IOC) Session at the Jio World Centre in Mumbai. The session is a key meeting of the IOC, where important decisions about the future of Olympic Games are made. India is hosting the session after a gap of 40 years, with the 86th session being held in New Delhi in 1983.

The 141st IOC Session represents India's commitment to fostering global cooperation, celebrating sporting excellence, and promoting Olympic values of friendship, respect and excellence. It also provides a platform for stakeholders in the sports industry to interact and share their knowledge.

The session will be attended by the President of the International Olympic Committee, Mr. Thomas Bach, other members of the IOC, prominent Indian sports personalities, and representatives from various sports federations, including the Indian Olympic Association.

title: PM interacts with dedicated personnel of the Army, BRO and ITBP at Parvati Kund and Gunji in Uttarakhand
description: On Tuesday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Parvati Kund and Gunji in Uttarakhand to interact with the dedicated personnel of the Indian Army, Border Roads Organisation (BRO) and Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP). He praised their selfless efforts and service in challenging conditions, and said that their spirit and dedication inspire the entire nation.

The Prime Minister took to Twitter to share his experience and post a few words of appreciation for the brave personnel. He wrote, 'At Parvati Kund and Gunji, interacted with the dedicated personnel of the Army, BRO and ITBP. Their unwavering service in challenging conditions is truly commendable. Their spirit and dedication inspire the entire nation.'

title: PM addresses Kaushal Dikshnat Samaroh 2023 via video message
description: Today, the Prime Minister of India, Shri Narendra Modi addressed the Kaushal Dikshnat Samaroh, a festival of skill development, via video message. He remarked that the event of joint convocation of skill development institutions across the country is a commendable initiative and reflects the priorities of today's India. Acknowledging the presence of thousands of youth connected with this event through technology, the Prime Minister conveyed his best wishes.

The Prime Minister highlighted the importance of the power of the youth in utilizing the strengths of a country and said that India is preparing its youth to take advantage of new opportunities through skilling and education, with the new National Education Policy being established after almost 4 decades. The Government is also establishing new medical colleges and skill development institutes to create more opportunities for the youth.

The Prime Minister noted that the whole world is of the belief that this century is going to be India's century due to the country's young population. India's proposal regarding global skill mapping has been accepted at the G20 Summit, which will help in creating better opportunities for the youth in the future. The Prime Minister suggested not wasting any opportunity being created and assured that the Government is ready to support the cause.

The Prime Minister noted the improved focus on skills, with 5 thousand new ITIs being set up in the country in the last 9 years and about 1.5 crore youth have been trained under the Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana. He emphasized the importance of skilling, upskilling and re-skilling and noted the rapidly changing demands and nature of jobs.

Highlighting the recent figures released by the International Monetary Fund, the Prime Minister informed that India will remain the fastest-growing major economy in the coming years. He also recalled his resolve to take India among the top three economies of the world and said that IMF is also confident of India becoming the top three economies of the world in the next 3-4 years.

Concluding the address, the Prime Minister stressed making India the biggest center of skilled manpower in the world in order to provide smart and skilled manpower solutions. He wished the youth success at every step in life.
keyWords: top three economies of the world

title: PM condoles loss of lives due to derailment of few coaches of North East Express
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has expressed his condolences for the loss of lives in the North East Express derailment. He has prayed for the quick recovery of the injured and has assured that authorities are providing all possible assistance to those affected.
The Prime Minister's Office posted on X that PM Modi was 'pained by the loss of lives due to the derailment of the North East Express' and offered his condolences to the bereaved families.

title: PM performs pooja at Parvati Kund, in Uttarakhand
description: The Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi recently visited Parvati Kund in Pithoragarh, Uttarakhand for darshan and pooja. He expressed his joy and gratitude for being able to witness the Aadi Kailash, and prayed for the welfare and happiness of all the citizens of India.
The Prime Minister shared his thoughts on X, expressing his contentment with the divine experience and his hope for all Indians to lead happy and prosperous lives.

title: PM to inaugurate the 9th G20 Parliamentary Speakers' Summit (P20) on 13 October
description: On 13 October 2023, Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi will inaugurate the 9th G20 Parliamentary Speakers' Summit (P20) at Yashobhoomi, New Delhi. The summit is being hosted by the Parliament of India under the broader framework of India’s G20 Presidency. The theme of the summit is “Parliaments for One Earth, One Family, One Future” and will be attended by Speakers of Parliaments of G20 members and invitee countries, including the Pan-African Parliament for the first time. The summit's sessions will focus on Transformation in People’s Lives through Public Digital Platforms; Women-led development; Accelerating SDGs; and Sustainable Energy Transition. A pre-summit Parliamentary Forum on LiFE (Lifestyle for Environment) will also be held on 12 October 2023.

The 9th G20 Parliamentary Speakers' Summit will be a unique opportunity to discuss and develop solutions to global issues like Sustainable Development Goals, gender equality, digital transformation, and energy transition. It will be an important step towards building a better future for all.

title: Special Campaign 3.0 of Department of Agricultural Research and Education during 2nd -7th October 2023
description: The Department of Agricultural Research and Education (DARE) is actively participating in the Special Campaign 3.0 driven by Government of India. The focus of the Department and its Attached Office/Autonomous Bodies and their field offices is to adapt cleanliness and elevate workplace experiences in their Offices/premises. In order to achieve this, DARE has identified 19843 physical files and 4717 E-files for review during the Special Campaign 3.0. Out of this, 6279 physical files have been reviewed so far, while 4171 physical files have been weeded out and 4717 electronic files reviewed with 1465 identified for closure. Additionally, 3326 'Special Campaign on Swachhata' have been conducted so far with a total revenue of Rs. 10,35,731/- generated. The campaign is still ongoing and will last until the 31st of October, 2023.

Secretary of DARE has encouraged all the officers to continue their efforts to reach the specified targets before the end of the campaign. The targets set by the Department are to bring all pendencies to 'zero' by 31st October, 2023 and free up 3326 square feet of space. The campaign has so far yielded positive results and is expected to reach a successful conclusion.
keyWords: Department of Agricultural Research and Education (DARE)

title: Shri Piyush Goyal chairs a Chintan Shivir with industrialists on "Unleashing the power of India’s Manufacturing Industry"
description: Union Minister of Commerce & Industry, Consumer Affairs, Food & Public Distribution and Textiles, Shri Piyush Goyal chaired the 'Chintan Shivir - Unleashing the power of India's Manufacturing Industry' at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi today. The event brought together industry leaders from across CII, FICCI, ASSOCHAM, ACMA, SIAM along with knowledge partners BCG and McKinsey.

The conclave served as a crucial platform for discussing the challenges and opportunities within India's manufacturing sector. The major focus was to understand and deliberate on increasing manufacturing capacities across various sectors and enhance contribution to GDP by 2030. Goyal asked the industry to accelerate production activity and contribute in making India a global hub for manufacturing.

The event evoked enriching discussions on 12 sectors (Textiles, Capital Goods, Auto and EV, Defence, Aerospace & Space, Metals & Mining, Leather & Footwear, Energy, Food Processing, Chemicals, Medical Devices, ESDM Value Chains, Drones) from manufacturing industry on key topics such as creating manufacturing ecosystem, maintaining quality standards, promoting domestic value addition, government policies and support, fostering industry agility. These discussions laid the foundation for innovative strategies, trade enhancement, integration with global supply chains and increased investments in the Indian Manufacturing Industry.
